Basement Underpinning in Toronto — Lower Your Basement, Strengthen Your Home

Engineered, permitted & WSIB‑covered underpinning to OBC 2024 (in force Jan 1, 2025). Toronto's official fee: $11.89/linear metre—we calculate and include it in your quote.

Unlock full‑height living space with basement underpinning in Toronto—designed by structural engineers, permitted and inspected to Ontario's current Building Code. We handle drawings, permits, and required inspections, provide WSIB Clearance, and include the Toronto linear‑metre permit fee in your estimate so there are no surprises.

Toronto permit math—no surprises

Underpinning permits are charged by linear metre. Applications on or after Jan 1, 2025 pay $11.89 per linear metre. We take the total metres from your stamped sequence drawings and include the fee in your quote.

View City of Toronto fee schedule →

Expected Timeline

Permit Decision

~10 business days (OBC target)

Excavation & Pits

3-4 weeks

Curing & Waterproofing

7-10 days

Slab & Finishing

1-2 weeks

Total: 6-10 weeks

from permit approval

Market Context

Toronto underpinning pricing varies widely based on scope:

  • •$350-$550/linear ft realistic Toronto range
  • •$50k-$120k typical total project cost
  • •Labor alone: $27k-40k (18-25 days)
  • •Bench footing: 25-35% less but reduces floor space

Sources: VMB Group, NuSite, Strong Basements
8-Step Proven Process

Our Professional Underpinning Process

From initial assessment to final inspection, every step is engineered for safety and compliance with Ontario Building Code 2024/25 standards

1

Site Visit & Measurements

Free comprehensive assessment of your basement, soil conditions, and access points

Same week booking
2

Structural Engineering & Stamped Drawings

Professional engineer creates detailed plans with Commitment to General Reviews

5-7 business days
3

Permit Submission

Complete Toronto underpinning application with sequence drawings & linear metres calculation

~10 business days review
4

Site Preparation

Install shoring, relocate services, establish dust control and safe egress routes

2-3 days
5

Sequential Underpinning Pits

Excavate and pour concrete in engineered sequence with OHSA safety controls

3-4 weeks
6

Drainage & Waterproofing

Install weeping tile system, sump pump, and exterior waterproof membrane

3-4 days
7

New Slab & Insulation

Pour reinforced concrete floor with integrated insulation system

2-3 days + cure time
8

Final Inspection & Handover

City inspection, WSIB clearance certificate, warranty documentation provided

1-2 days

Safety First, By The Book

Underpinning is a specialized high-risk task. We plan and execute sequential pits with engineered shoring and inspections aligned to Ontario OHSA underpinning guidance. Our crews carry current WSIB clearance; all subcontractors are verified.

View OHSA GuidelinesWSIB Coverage Info
🏗️

Mass Concrete Pour

Traditional method using sequential excavation and concrete pours. Most cost-effective for standard conditions.

🔧

Beam & Base

Reinforced concrete beams support loads during excavation. Ideal for challenging soil conditions.

⚙️

Mini-Piles

Steel piles driven to bedrock for maximum stability. Required for extremely poor soil or high water tables.

Toronto Permits & Compliance Made Simple

We handle all permit requirements and ensure full compliance with OBC 2024/25 (in force January 1, 2025) and City of Toronto regulations

What Toronto Requires for Underpinning

Required Drawings:

  • Site plan showing property boundaries and existing structures
  • Foundation/underpinning plans showing stages and total linear metres
  • Structural details and sequencing diagrams

Required Forms:

  • Application to Construct or Demolish
  • Designer Information (Schedule 1)
  • Commitment to General Review by Engineer
  • Tree Declaration Form (if applicable)
  • Rental Housing Demolition screening
View Official Toronto Requirements →

Toronto Permit Fee Structure

$11.89 per linear metre

Effective January 1, 2025 • City of Toronto

We calculate the exact linear metres from your engineered sequence drawings and include the permit fee in your detailed quote—no hidden add-ons.

Example: 100 ft perimeter = 30.48m = $362 permit fee

Review Timeline

House Stream Review

OBC targets ~10 business days for residential permits

Express Services Available

Expedited review for qualifying projects

Actual Timeline Varies

Depends on submission completeness and City workload

Required Inspections & Compliance Steps

Pre-Construction

Verify permit posted, tree protection, sediment control

During Excavation

Stage inspections for each underpinning pit sequence

Before Backfill

Waterproofing, weeping tile, foundation wall inspection

Final Inspection

Complete work verification to close permit

WSIB Coverage & Safety Compliance

We operate under WSIB expanded compulsory coverage for construction businesses. We provide a WSIB Clearance Certificate for every project and verify all subcontractor coverage. Note that homeowner-only exemptions don't apply to our commercial scope.

What We Provide:

  • • WSIB Clearance Certificate
  • • Liability insurance proof
  • • Engineer oversight documentation
  • • Safety program compliance

Compliance Standards:

  • • OBC 2024/25 (effective Jan 1, 2025)
  • • OHSA underpinning hazards
  • • Toronto building bylaws
  • • Professional engineer standards
WSIB Expanded Coverage Info →OBC 2024 Compendium →

Underpinning vs. Bench Footing: Choose the Right Method

Both methods lower your basement floor, but they differ in cost, timeline, and final usable space

Full UnderpinningMaximum space, higher investment

Advantages:

  • Maximizes usable floor space - no lost square footage
  • Best for legal suite readiness (full 1.95m+ height)
  • Strengthens existing foundation
  • Highest property value increase

Considerations:

  • Higher cost ($250-400 per linear foot)
  • Longer timeline (6-10 weeks)
  • More complex engineering required

Best For: Maximum space needs, rental suites, narrow basements

Bench FootingFaster and cheaper, reduced floor area

Advantages:

  • 20-30% lower cost than underpinning
  • Faster completion (4-6 weeks)
  • Less structural risk
  • Simpler permit process

Considerations:

  • Creates bench along walls (2-4 ft wide)
  • Reduces usable floor space by 15-25%
  • May limit furniture placement options

Best For: Large basements, storage focus, budget-conscious projects

Quick Comparison

FactorUnderpinningBench Footing
Cost Range$250-400/linear ft$175-280/linear ft
Timeline6-10 weeks4-6 weeks
Floor Space100% preserved75-85% usable
Legal Suite Ready
Structural RiskHigher (managed)Lower
ROIHighestModerate

Not sure which method is right for your basement? Our engineers will assess your specific situation.
